source.name: Libraries - 2013 Computer Sessions by Location
source.description: The Chicago Public Library offers one-hour computer sessions and 15-minute computer sessions.  The Chicago Public Library consists of the Harold Washington Library Center, Sulzer and Woodson regional libraries and over 70 neighborhood branches. Edgewater Branch closed on 6/6/2011 for construction of a new branch, scheduled to open in mid-2013. Edgewater’s Holds pick up and returns have been managed out of the library’s bookmobile, which is parked at the nearby armory. Humboldt Park Branch closed on 3/26/2012 for construction of a 5,000 sq. ft. addition to the existing branch and reopened to the public on 2/9/2013. Albany Park Branch closed to the public on 9/22/2012 for construction of a new branch library. The new library’s anticipated opening is in 2014. Interim services are being provided in the Albany Park community. Brighton Park, Jefferson Park and Portage-Cragin branch libraries were closed from 11/26/2012-12/7/2012 for replacement of their HVAC systems.  Gage Park Branch closed between 2/22/2013-3/1/2013 for full carpet replacement. Many locations experience sporadic emergency closures due to heating or air conditioning issues, or area power outages.
